text:
Google is expected to launch their video game streaming service and a pseudo-console today. Having used Project Stream(the beta version that allowed you to play Assassin’s creed) and a service called OnLive(which unfortunately went under) I can say I’m definitely excited for this.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nUih5C5rOrA>
Just saw this and thought maybe of interest to people. <https://github.com/Microsoft/frontend-bootcamp?mc_cid=d123b965ca&mc_eid=41318a76e5>
neat
I call them curly brackets
i call em squigglies
Is there a succinct way to get the row count using hubdb_table_column? I'm trying to get a count of matching rows for each filter option.
hahaha
yea, just trying to come up with a HubL related name for something I’m working on
You would need to execute the query using `hubdb_table_rows` and check the result
announcement is happening
:takemymoney:
some prettttyyyy coool stuff
agreed
now the question is - how do I build a business around this and become a billionaire
should be easy
hahaha
use it to create a game that visualizes the big bang infinitely through time with the ability to view and affect the events unfolding down to the atomic level, in addition to the macro universe level
then add multiplayer. no biggie
and then melt Google servers
might need quantum to get a little more accessible before I steal that idea
Well everyone, I peaked, its been fun, im ready to retire lol <https://twitter.com/googleanalytics/status/1108077429833322502>
well done!
haha, freaking awesome AJ
Yeah, son!
I'm hardcore geeking out over here lol
having never used google data studio you have me now interested

Its awesome, I know people throw Databox out alot as a great way to show data to users, and I agree, its nice because of the HubSpot connection, but DataStudio is just much more complex in what you can do and when you use a connector like Supermetrics, you can create awesome reports for people
i really like it too, awesome tool
has someone used the Reporting API for Analytics?

What does everyone use for slide deck creations? I was using ludas.one but they are terminating their free plan so i need to move my slide deck to something else... I know there is Google Slides but wasnt sure if anyone used anything else
I use google slides. tried <http://beautiful.ai|beautiful.ai> a year ago felt it was fake artificial intelligence, and didn’t let me create layouts I wanted.

I’ve heard about people using this: <https://revealjs.com/#/>
lol so if you’re like “I know better than Google Slides and Powerpoint, let me do what I do best”
similar framework <http://imakewebthings.com/deck.js/#intro>
BTW, not that you need street cred now that you’re Google Twitter famous, but you definitely get some street cred using html css and js for your slide deck :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:

I was thinking of doing it that way but then I am thinking about if it were to be presented at conferences or the like, would it be easier to use something like Google Slides where they have the Q/A thing
Congrats AJ! We've just started using Databox but I might need to check this out now
if it was just straight up web only, totally would do it with JS CSS and what not

Thanks <@UDFSF3N1F>! Let me know if you have any questions on Data Studio. I know for us, when we had to report HS data, we just put in a google doc for the moment (I keep pressing supermetrics on their HS integration and beta connector, no luck for release yet)
hopefully this will make my idea from the forums of the Data Studio connector come to life lol #playingthelonggame

Will do, defintely a lot to play around with. I personally never had to do the reporting but I had to walk people thourgh HubSpot reporting on the reg, mostly because if I didn't everyone would try to find data their own way and HubSpot has this knack for using the same terminology for metrics but measuring them slightly differently
I would say Google Slides is probably the safest bet. Easily exports to keynote or powerpoint if needed.
if you want to make people throw up from motion sickness you could use prezi, but that might be out of style now
